links.*: Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien
The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide

wikitext.*:
On [[2 December]] [[1968]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to [[Rayner Unwin]]'''.

* '''Contents:''' Tolkien responds to Unwin regarding negotiations of film rights with [[United Artists]]. He also mentions his unpublished story ''[[The End of Bovadium]]'', which he has "no intention of publishing now (if ever)".<ref> {{CG|2I}}, Entry: '''2 December 1968'''</ref>

* '''Publication:''' Short quotes and a summary were published by [[Wayne Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]] in the ''Chronology'' volume of [[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide]].

{{references}}

[[Category:Letters|Unwin, Rayner (1968-12-02)]]
